title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - ISAF Deployment Enhancement

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to provide pre-deployment training and improve the tactical effectiveness of long-range communications, signals intelligence, fires and close air support, and logistics capabilities of Latvian forces deployed to Afghanistan to support the ISAF mission. Equipment provided includes communications items, C-IED items, and cargo handling equipment. The recipient units will be the Land Forces Brigade and Special Task Unit under the Latvian National Armed Forces (LNAF).

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Joint Terminal Attack Controller Capability Training and Engagement

description.narrative: Section 2282 Building Capacity of Foreign Security Forces programs (formerly known as Section 1206 Train and Equip), are intended to build partnership capacity for time-sensitive "new and emerging" counter-terrorist operations or to participate in or support military and stability operations in which the U.S. Armed Forces are a participant.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Border Security (Mobility)

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: Ministry of Defense Advisors Program

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. A MoDA is assisting the Latvian Ministry of Defense with defense planning reform initiatives. Long-term defense capacity building objectives are being achieved.
